alert.note: Alert for Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Kanawha, southwestern Putnam and northeastern Lincoln Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alum Creek, or 9 miles southwest of Nitro, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Hamlin, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Alum Creek, Institute, Tornado, West Hamlin, Sweetland, Sod, Griffithsville, Yawkey and Myra. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 51 and 57. Route 119 between mile markers 64 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
